data.title: DIRECTORY OF SOVIET OFFICIALS: REPUBLIC ORGANIZATIONS
data.text: Declassified and Approved For Release 2011/12/12 : CIA-RDP93T00643R000201480001-3 Directorate of Intelligence Directory of Soviet Officials: Republic Organizations For Data Entry LDA 87-10509 (Supersedes CR 85-10140) March 1987 Declassified and Approved For Release 2011/12/12 : CIA-RDP93T00643R000201480001-3 Declassified and Approved For Release 2011/12/12 : CIA-RDP93T00643R000201480001-3 This publication is prepared for the use of US Government officials, and the format, coverage, and content are designed to meet their specific requirements. US Government officials may obtain additional copies of this document directly or through liaison channels from the Central Intelligence Agency. Requesters outside the US Government may obtain subscriptions to CIA publications similar to this one by addressing inquiries to: Document Expediting (DOCEX) Project Exchange and Gift Division Library of Congress Washington, D.C. 20540 or: National Technical Information Service 5285 Port Royal Road Springfield, VA 22161 Requesters outside the US Government not interested in subscription service may purchase specific publications either in paper copy or microform from: National Technical Information Service 5285 Port Royal Road Springfield, VA 22161 (To expedite service call the NTIS Order Desk (703) 487-4650) or: Photoduplication Service Library of Congress Washington, D.C. 20540 Declassified and Approved For Release 2011/12/12 : CIA-RDP93T00643R000201480001-3 Declassified and Approved For Release 2011/12/12 : CIA-RDP93T00643R000201480001-3 Directory of Soviet Officials: Republic Organizations Information available as of 1 March 1987 was used in the preparation of this publication. LDA 87-10509 (Supersedes CR 85-10140) March 1987 Declassified and Approved For Release 2011/12/12 : CIA-RDP93T00643R000201480001-3 Declassified and Approved For Release 2011/12/12 : CIA-RDP93T00643R000201480001-3 The Directory of Soviet Officials identifies individuals who hold posi- tions in selected party, government, and public organizations of the USSR. It may be used to find the incumbents of given positions within an organization or the positions of given individuals. For some organizations, it serves as a guide to the internal structure of the organization. Coverage. This publication supersedes Directory of Soviet Officials: Republic Organizations (CR 85-10140, January 1985). It is one of a three-volume series: the other volumes deal with national-level organizations and with scientific and educational organizations. The Republic directory begins with the Russian Soviet Federated Socialist Republic (RSFSR)-by far the largest republic in the USSR-followed by special sections for Moscow and Lenin- grad, the nation's two largest cities. The other republics follow in English alphabetical order. An index to major organizations, and a personality index are included at the end of the publication. Duplicate names in the personality index refer to different individuals who have the same name. The union republics are not uniform in the kinds of organizations they contain, and the nomenclature for similar organizations varies among the republics and between the republic and national levels. A subject area covered by an administration or main administration in one republic may be covered by a state committee or a ministry in another. In the republic government list- ings, no attempt has been made to cover positions below the level of minister or state committee chairman. In the Communist Party apparatus listings, coverage is limited to chiefs of Central Committee departments. Each republic's Supreme Soviet (legislature) has a presidium, which is a body empowered to issue decrees, appoint ministers, and perform other functions between legislative sessions. The chairman of the presidium is the chief of state of the republic. For each republic, the chairman and deputy chairman have been included; the remaining members of the legislature are not listed as a group. For larger republics that contain major subdivisions known as oblasts, the top level of party and government leaders is listed for the oblasts as well as for the republic's capital city; for republics having only the smaller subdivisions known as rayons, only the leaders of the capital and other major cities are listed. Directory Abbreviations and Dates. The date an individual assumed his position is listed in the position" column. Dates are preceded by the abbreviations ap" (appointed), el" (elected), or id" (identified in the position). Partial dates are given when exact dates are not known (for example, when identifications are taken from books or periodicals). Dates of birth are listed in the birth" column when known. In most cases, only the last two digits of a year are listed. For example, 97 refers to 1897, 00 indicates 1900, and 17 in- dicates 1917. Names are given in full where known. Military ranks and/or the highest earned academic degree are listed for some individuals. A list of abbreviations follows the Table of Contents. Declassified and Approved For Release 2011/12/12 : CIA-RDP93T00643R000201480001-3 Declassified and Approved For Release 2011/12/12 : CIA-RDP93T00643R000201480001-3 Rendering of Proper Names. Transliteration generally follows the system authorized by the Board of Geographic Names (BGN). Non-Russian names (such as those of Ukrainian or Estonian origin) for which original Latin alphabet spellings or separate BGN transliteration systems exist are treated as Russian names and are transliterated from their Russian spellings. (For instance, the Ukrainian surname Honchar" is rendered Gonchar.") Excep- tions are the city of Kiev (BGN spelling is Kiyev) and the names of the repub- lics themselves, which reflect accepted Westernized forms (Lithuania" for Litva," "Georgia" for Gruziya," etc.). The Russian words kray, oblast, okrug, and rayon-standard terms for territorial and administrative units in the USSR-are not translated. Place names have been translated where possible (Primorskiy kray, for example, is rendered as Maritime Kray), and Russian adjectival endings have been eliminated in translation (Leningradskaya oblast is rendered as Leningrad Oblast). Soft signs have been omitted from the English renderings of place names. Organizations. An effort has been made to verify and standardize the names of organizational components and the position titles of individuals, but some unverified entries remain for names whose sole source is a non-Soviet publication. Date of Information. This volume reflects information received by 1 March 1987. Republic level population and Communist Party membership statics are based on January 1985 data unless otherwise noted and are drawn from the Great Soviet Encyclopedia 1985 Yearbook. Oblast or other regional population figures reflect January 1982 data unless otherwise noted and are drawn from Narodnoye Khozyaystvo SSSR 1922-1982 (National Economy USSR 1922-1982), 1982. Declassified and Approved For Release 2011/12/12 : CIA-RDP93T00643R000201480001-3 Declassified and Approved For Release 2011/12/12 : CIA-RDP93T00643R000201480001-3 ABBREVIATIONS The following list includes abbreviations used throughout the Directory of Soviet Officials.
